intro: Hieracium subramosum subsp. surrejanum, commonly known as the Southern Hieracium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. This subspecies is native to southern Europe and is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm and has a compact, upright growth habit. The plant is known for its ability to thrive in poor soils and is often used in ecological restoration projects.
